values.description:
`qFuzzyCompare` is just a function and not a macro that fails the test when compared values are not the same.

Switched to using `QVERIFY(ignition::math::equal(a, b))` for comparison of doubles
values.title: Remove qFuzzyCompare in JointMaker test

summary.raw:
`qFuzzyCompare` is just a function and not a macro that fails the test when compared values are not the same.

Switched to using `QVERIFY(ignition::math::equal(a, b))` for comparison of doubles
summary.html:
qFuzzyCompare is just a function and not a macro that fails the test when compared values are not the same.

values.description:
Some problems have been observed with linking against Boost in downstream packages that use `find_package(gazebo)`. The problem is that the specific Boost components that are specified in [cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/75802f080f755d66f6d3bf80a2c1a7176778d7cc/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake#SearchForStuff.cmake-499) were not included in the [gazebo-config.cmake.in](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/75802f080f755d66f6d3bf80a2c1a7176778d7cc/cmake/gazebo-config.cmake.in#gazebo-config.cmake.in-49) template (see #1692 for more details). The fix is to search for these components explicitly in that template.

To show that it works, I have simplified the example CMakeLists.txt files so that they only search for gazebo, not protobuf, Boost, or SDFormat. A [jenkins no-gpu build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/582/) shows all the example tests passing.

I also replace the following statement:

~~~
set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")
~~~

with

~~~
list(APPEND CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")
~~~

I think @dirk-thomas recommends using the `list(APPEND)` syntax.
values.title: Search for Boost components in gazebo-config.cmake (#1692)

summary.raw:
Some problems have been observed with linking against Boost in downstream packages that use `find_package(gazebo)`. The problem is that the specific Boost components that are specified in [cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/75802f080f755d66f6d3bf80a2c1a7176778d7cc/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake#SearchForStuff.cmake-499) were not included in the [gazebo-config.cmake.in](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/75802f080f755d66f6d3bf80a2c1a7176778d7cc/cmake/gazebo-config.cmake.in#gazebo-config.cmake.in-49) template (see #1692 for more details). The fix is to search for these components explicitly in that template.

To show that it works, I have simplified the example CMakeLists.txt files so that they only search for gazebo, not protobuf, Boost, or SDFormat. A [jenkins no-gpu build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/582/) shows all the example tests passing.

I also replace the following statement:

~~~
set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")
~~~

with

~~~
list(APPEND CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")
~~~

I think @dirk-thomas recommends using the `list(APPEND)` syntax.
summary.html:
Some problems have been observed with linking against Boost in downstream packages that use find_package(gazebo). The problem is that the specific Boost components that are specified in cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake were not included in the gazebo-config.cmake.in template (see #1692 for more details). The fix is to search for these components explicitly in that template.

To show that it works, I have simplified the example CMakeLists.txt files so that they only search for gazebo, not protobuf, Boost, or SDFormat. A jenkins no-gpu build shows all the example tests passing.

I also replace the following statement:

set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")

with

list(APPEND CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")

I think @dirk-thomas recommends using the list(APPEND) syntax.

values.description:
Added copy constructor and assignment operator to MouseEvent to properly copy private data object. One place that uses this is [ModelManipulator](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/cdf65e4088f1fe7a0d3b9c6d8070aa91c94443a7/gazebo/gui/ModelManipulator.cc#ModelManipulator.cc-565)

This fixes the `double free or corruption` crashes I've been seeing when exiting gzclient.

Steps to reproduce crash: Insert box -> Translate it -> immediately hit Ctrl+Q to exit -> crash

Added test. Test crashes if the two functions are not there.

maybe related to issue #1676 - there could be other causes of the crash but this fixes one of them.
values.title: MouseEvent deep copy and gzclient exit crash fix

Added copy constructor and assignment operator to MouseEvent to properly copy private data object. One place that uses this is ModelManipulator

This fixes the double free or corruption crashes I've been seeing when exiting gzclient.

Steps to reproduce crash: Insert box -> Translate it -> immediately hit Ctrl+Q to exit -> crash

Added test. Test crashes if the two functions are not there.

maybe related to issue #1676 - there could be other causes of the crash but this fixes one of them.

values.description:
When a link's kinematic property is set to true, `dBodySetKinematic` is called on that link and its mass becomes infinite. The problem is that, later on, its mass is set to something else, even when inertial properties are not specified. This is due to the fact that, by default, a link is given a mass of 1.0.

I see two ways to fix this issue:

- The SDF format could be modified to allow a link not to have a mass.

- If a link is kinematic, its mass must not be set.

This pull request implements the second idea.
values.title: Do not update the center of mass if object is kinematic

summary.raw:
When a link's kinematic property is set to true, `dBodySetKinematic` is called on that link and its mass becomes infinite. The problem is that, later on, its mass is set to something else, even when inertial properties are not specified. This is due to the fact that, by default, a link is given a mass of 1.0.

I see two ways to fix this issue:

- The SDF format could be modified to allow a link not to have a mass.

- If a link is kinematic, its mass must not be set.

This pull request implements the second idea.
summary.html:
When a link's kinematic property is set to true, dBodySetKinematic is called on that link and its mass becomes infinite. The problem is that, later on, its mass is set to something else, even when inertial properties are not specified. This is due to the fact that, by default, a link is given a mass of 1.0.

I see two ways to fix this issue:

  • The SDF format could be modified to allow a link not to have a mass.

  • If a link is kinematic, its mass must not be set.

This pull request implements the second idea.

values.description:
`ConfigWidget` offers a lot of functionality to uniformly style widgets and set/get values from them. However, currently the only way to create such a widget is by parsing messages. This pull request exposes a basic API to allow creating custom `ConfigWidget`s with all the styling and functionality but without the need for messages. This will be used in the new Model Editor joint creation tool.

* Made all `Create*` functions public (and moved them up, thus the big diff)

* Added functions `CreateGroupWidget`, `AddConfigChildWidget` and `ConfigChildWidgetCount`

* Added a test where a custom config widget is created.
values.title: Make it possible to create custom ConfigWidgets

summary.raw:
`ConfigWidget` offers a lot of functionality to uniformly style widgets and set/get values from them. However, currently the only way to create such a widget is by parsing messages. This pull request exposes a basic API to allow creating custom `ConfigWidget`s with all the styling and functionality but without the need for messages. This will be used in the new Model Editor joint creation tool.

* Made all `Create*` functions public (and moved them up, thus the big diff)

* Added functions `CreateGroupWidget`, `AddConfigChildWidget` and `ConfigChildWidgetCount`

* Added a test where a custom config widget is created.
summary.html:
ConfigWidget offers a lot of functionality to uniformly style widgets and set/get values from them. However, currently the only way to create such a widget is by parsing messages. This pull request exposes a basic API to allow creating custom ConfigWidgets with all the styling and functionality but without the need for messages. This will be used in the new Model Editor joint creation tool.

  • Made all Create* functions public (and moved them up, thus the big diff)

  • Added functions CreateGroupWidget, AddConfigChildWidget and ConfigChildWidgetCount

  • Added a test where a custom config widget is created.

values.description:
Fixes issue #1697

I introduced the issue on pull request #1762, when propagating transparency changes to child nodes/entities.

~~A temporary solution I found right now is to only apply the fix if the material is not fully opaque. It feels like a hack though, but after digging for a bit I realized it would be a big effort to go though the way we're dealing with ogre passes.~~ See activity for latest fix

With this fix, both blended textures and the propagation of transparency used in `LinkFrameVisual` work at the same time:

![field.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3764878903-field.png)
values.title: Fix transparency correction for opaque materials

summary.raw:
Fixes issue #1697

I introduced the issue on pull request #1762, when propagating transparency changes to child nodes/entities.

~~A temporary solution I found right now is to only apply the fix if the material is not fully opaque. It feels like a hack though, but after digging for a bit I realized it would be a big effort to go though the way we're dealing with ogre passes.~~ See activity for latest fix

With this fix, both blended textures and the propagation of transparency used in `LinkFrameVisual` work at the same time:

![field.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3764878903-field.png)
summary.html:
Fixes issue #1697

I introduced the issue on pull request #1762, when propagating transparency changes to child nodes/entities.

A temporary solution I found right now is to only apply the fix if the material is not fully opaque. It feels like a hack though, but after digging for a bit I realized it would be a big effort to go though the way we're dealing with ogre passes. See activity for latest fix

With this fix, both blended textures and the propagation of transparency used in LinkFrameVisual work at the same time:

values.description:
1. Load a model which has model plugins. For example:

    `gazebo worlds/initial_velocity.world`
    
1. Edit the model (right-click-> Edit Model). You'll see the model plugin name on the palette under Model Plugins (`large_wz`)

1. Double-click the plugin name to see its contents.

![modelPlugin.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/156906869-modelPlugin.png)


# Next steps

* Make it possible to delete a plugin

* Context menu when right-clicking plugin, with options to open inspector or delete it

* Make plugin inner xml editable - initially without format checking?

* Add an option to add plugins - initially from a hard-coded list?

* Once issue #1699 is addressed, improve plugin param editing and plugin listing
values.title: Display model plugins in the Model Editor

summary.raw:
1. Load a model which has model plugins. For example:

    `gazebo worlds/initial_velocity.world`
    
1. Edit the model (right-click-> Edit Model). You'll see the model plugin name on the palette under Model Plugins (`large_wz`)

1. Double-click the plugin name to see its contents.

![modelPlugin.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/156906869-modelPlugin.png)


# Next steps

* Make it possible to delete a plugin

* Context menu when right-clicking plugin, with options to open inspector or delete it

* Make plugin inner xml editable - initially without format checking?

* Add an option to add plugins - initially from a hard-coded list?

* Once issue #1699 is addressed, improve plugin param editing and plugin listing
summary.html:
1. Load a model which has model plugins. For example:

    gazebo worlds/initial_velocity.world

  2. Edit the model (right-click-> Edit Model). You'll see the model plugin name on the palette under Model Plugins (large_wz)

  3. Double-click the plugin name to see its contents.

Next steps

  • Make it possible to delete a plugin

  • Context menu when right-clicking plugin, with options to open inspector or delete it

  • Make plugin inner xml editable - initially without format checking?

  • Add an option to add plugins - initially from a hard-coded list?

  • Once issue #1699 is addressed, improve plugin param editing and plugin listing

values.description:
* Add new WideAngleCameraSensor
* WideAngleCamera contains Lens description that allows flexible control over the projection
* New transport message type to control camera lens, and read it's state

Camera renders the world 6 times in different directions, to cube map texture. Then Ogre::Compositor is used to map the world to camera sensor according to the lens properties

It depends on [Pull request to sdformat #215](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/215/camera-lens-description)
values.title: WideAngle Camera

summary.raw:
* Add new WideAngleCameraSensor
* WideAngleCamera contains Lens description that allows flexible control over the projection
* New transport message type to control camera lens, and read it's state

Camera renders the world 6 times in different directions, to cube map texture. Then Ogre::Compositor is used to map the world to camera sensor according to the lens properties

It depends on [Pull request to sdformat #215](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/215/camera-lens-description)

• Add new WideAngleCameraSensor
  • WideAngleCamera contains Lens description that allows flexible control over the projection
  • New transport message type to control camera lens, and read it's state

Camera renders the world 6 times in different directions, to cube map texture. Then Ogre::Compositor is used to map the world to camera sensor according to the lens properties

It depends on Pull request to sdformat #215

values.description:
This example demonstrates how to use transport messages to control the lens of the WideAngleCamera.

It create a GUI overlay for gzclient, that allows to spawn new instances of wideangle camera sensor. It subscribes to ~/selection topic and allows to change lens properties of selected camera.

This pull request depends on [#1866](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1866/wideangle-camera)
values.title: Camera Lens Control Example

summary.raw:
This example demonstrates how to use transport messages to control the lens of the WideAngleCamera.

It create a GUI overlay for gzclient, that allows to spawn new instances of wideangle camera sensor. It subscribes to ~/selection topic and allows to change lens properties of selected camera.

This pull request depends on [#1866](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1866/wideangle-camera)
summary.html:
This example demonstrates how to use transport messages to control the lens of the WideAngleCamera.

It create a GUI overlay for gzclient, that allows to spawn new instances of wideangle camera sensor. It subscribes to ~/selection topic and allows to change lens properties of selected camera.

This pull request depends on #1866

values.reason: Thanks for the contribution. I had some free time, so I cloned your code and resubmitted it in pull request #1941. This should help speed up its approval.

values.description:
Part 1 - Support nested model

Depends on sdformat [pull request #214](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/214/support-nesting-of-model-sdf-elements/diff)

example:

~~~
<model>
  <link> ... </link>
  ...
  <model>
    <link> ... </link>
      ...
  <model>
</model>
~~~

In this PR:

- update logic to find canonical link - there should only be one in the whole model tree

- add support for joints between nested models

- update model msgs so that they appear correctly on the rendering side


Still to come in later pull requests: 

- saving and loading nested models

- gui for interacting with nested models

- editing nested models
values.title: Nested model - part 1

summary.html:
Part 1 - Support nested model

Depends on sdformat pull request #214

example:

<model>
  <link> ... </link>
  ...
  <model>
    <link> ... </link>
      ...
  <model>
</model>

In this PR:

  • update logic to find canonical link - there should only be one in the whole model tree

  • add support for joints between nested models

  • update model msgs so that they appear correctly on the rendering side

Still to come in later pull requests:

  • saving and loading nested models

  • gui for interacting with nested models

  • editing nested models

values.description:
* Moved top toolbar to its own class with a test to better handle action visibility

* Hide Insert tab during playback

* Hide Edit menu and some other menu actions during playback

* Hide several actions from the `ModelRightMenu` during playback

* Disable several hotkeys during playback

* Added a test for the new function in the `MainWindow` but not for the `ModelRightMenu` because it proved to be quite complicated. Let me know if you wanna hear about it.

![toptoolbar1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1335300324-toptoolbar1.png)

# During playback:

![toptoolbar2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1630877340-toptoolbar2.png)

values.description: It's bad practice to have the build folder hard-coded in a world file. This is used in a tutorial, so we should fix it to set a good example.
values.title: Remove build/ from plugin filename in model_push example tutorial

values.description:
GUI plugin tutorials weren't working with `gazebo5` because of missing C++11 flags.

This tutorial brings the CMakeLists from gazebo6 to gazebo5, which work for both versions. Once this is merging, anyone using gazebo5 or gazebo6 should be able to follow the same tutorial.

[This](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/249/gui-overlay-plugins-for-gazebo6/diff) tutorials pull request updates the gazebo5+ tutorial to get files from the gazebo5 branch instead of default, so future changes to default don't break the tutorial (as has happened before).
values.title: Fix GUI plugin tutorials on Gazebo5

summary.raw:
GUI plugin tutorials weren't working with `gazebo5` because of missing C++11 flags.

This tutorial brings the CMakeLists from gazebo6 to gazebo5, which work for both versions. Once this is merging, anyone using gazebo5 or gazebo6 should be able to follow the same tutorial.

[This](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/249/gui-overlay-plugins-for-gazebo6/diff) tutorials pull request updates the gazebo5+ tutorial to get files from the gazebo5 branch instead of default, so future changes to default don't break the tutorial (as has happened before).
summary.html:
GUI plugin tutorials weren't working with gazebo5 because of missing C++11 flags.

This tutorial brings the CMakeLists from gazebo6 to gazebo5, which work for both versions. Once this is merging, anyone using gazebo5 or gazebo6 should be able to follow the same tutorial.

This tutorials pull request updates the gazebo5+ tutorial to get files from the gazebo5 branch instead of default, so future changes to default don't break the tutorial (as has happened before).

values.description:
This pull request allows to load gzserver from ServerFixture using any of the command line parameters. The motivation for this pull request was to be able to playback a log file from an integration test.

CI results:

* [No-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/615/).
* [GPU](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/467/).
* [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/470/).
values.title: Load a server with any argument

summary.raw:
This pull request allows to load gzserver from ServerFixture using any of the command line parameters. The motivation for this pull request was to be able to playback a log file from an integration test.

CI results:

* [No-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/615/).
* [GPU](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/467/).
* [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/470/).
summary.html:
This pull request allows to load gzserver from ServerFixture using any of the command line parameters. The motivation for this pull request was to be able to playback a log file from an integration test.

CI results:

  • No-gpu.
  • GPU.
  • Homebrew.

values.description: Use `msgs::ModelToSDF` and `msgs::AddSphereLink` to improve the inertia calculation of spawned spheres. This was motivated by [discussion in a gazebo_tutorials pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/249/gui-overlay-plugins-for-gazebo5-6/activity#comment-9327099). Since this change requires gazebo 5.1 and we have a number of users on gazebo 5.0.1 (default for ROS Jade and Ubuntu Vivid), I'm targeting this change to the gazebo6 branch, so it won't be reflected in that tutorial.
values.title: Improve inertia calculation in gui_overlay_plugin_spawn example

values.description:
Add functions to Add/Remove items from a child enum widget and a function to Clear all items. I'm using this in the new joint inspector to fix issue #1500 and also on the new joint creation dialog.

Also moved the `EnumValueChanged` connection to the `CreateEnumWidget` function, so custom enum widgets (those not generated by parsing a message) are also connected.
values.title: More functions to handle enum config widgets

summary.raw:
Add functions to Add/Remove items from a child enum widget and a function to Clear all items. I'm using this in the new joint inspector to fix issue #1500 and also on the new joint creation dialog.

Also moved the `EnumValueChanged` connection to the `CreateEnumWidget` function, so custom enum widgets (those not generated by parsing a message) are also connected.
summary.html:
Add functions to Add/Remove items from a child enum widget and a function to Clear all items. I'm using this in the new joint inspector to fix issue #1500 and also on the new joint creation dialog.

Also moved the EnumValueChanged connection to the CreateEnumWidget function, so custom enum widgets (those not generated by parsing a message) are also connected.

values.description:
I was debugging some camera issues, and I noticed that the `CameraVisual` wasn't matching the images generated by the camera, as shown in the topic visualizer. I tracked it down to some of the CameraSensor parameters not being added in `Sensor::FillMsg` for camera sensors. I've added these fields and a test.

The test passed with the [trusty nvidia build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/479/).
values.title: Fill more fields in CameraSensor::FillMsg

summary.raw:
I was debugging some camera issues, and I noticed that the `CameraVisual` wasn't matching the images generated by the camera, as shown in the topic visualizer. I tracked it down to some of the CameraSensor parameters not being added in `Sensor::FillMsg` for camera sensors. I've added these fields and a test.

The test passed with the [trusty nvidia build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/479/).
summary.html:
I was debugging some camera issues, and I noticed that the CameraVisual wasn't matching the images generated by the camera, as shown in the topic visualizer. I tracked it down to some of the CameraSensor parameters not being added in Sensor::FillMsg for camera sensors. I've added these fields and a test.

The test passed with the trusty nvidia build.

values.description:
Have all child config widgets emit signals when their values are edited by the user.

Currently this is only possible for enum child widgets, this pull request extends it for all other supported types.

I'm using this on the new joint creation tool for M2.

This will probably also be useful for undo.
values.title: Config widget signals

summary.raw:
Have all child config widgets emit signals when their values are edited by the user.

Currently this is only possible for enum child widgets, this pull request extends it for all other supported types.

I'm using this on the new joint creation tool for M2.

This will probably also be useful for undo.

Have all child config widgets emit signals when their values are edited by the user.

Currently this is only possible for enum child widgets, this pull request extends it for all other supported types.

I'm using this on the new joint creation tool for M2.

This will probably also be useful for undo.

values.description:
This pull request doesn't add new functionality, just adds a new `world_playback` integration test for checking the playback control via messages.

There are still some cases uncovered by these tests where the logging doesn't work. Those cases will be added in a future pull request with the fixes for keeping the changes small.

There's a small fix in LogPlay::Open() that caused problems when opening two log files in a row (this happens during testing).

CI results:

  * [No GPU](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/642/)
  * [Nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/487/#showFailuresLink)
  * [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/499/#showFailuresLink)
values.title: Playback testing

There are still some cases uncovered by these tests where the logging doesn't work. Those cases will be added in a future pull request with the fixes for keeping the changes small.

values.description:
Issue #1500

* Added the possibility of changing parent / child for joints. Currently, you'd need to delete the joint and make a new one if you chose the wrong links.

* Added a "Swap" button to swap parent and child links

* If chosen parent and child links are the same, they're highlighted in warning colors and the Apply / Ok buttons disabled.

![jointInspector1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/139993849-jointInspector1.png)

![jointInspector2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2975755465-jointInspector2.png)

All styling will probably be improved in a future pull request once @spaepcke gets to take a look at it. We'll probably use an icon instead of the word "Swap" on the button and maybe handle the red colors differently.
values.title: Choose / swap parent and child links in joint inspector

summary.raw:
Issue #1500

* Added the possibility of changing parent / child for joints. Currently, you'd need to delete the joint and make a new one if you chose the wrong links.

* Added a "Swap" button to swap parent and child links

* If chosen parent and child links are the same, they're highlighted in warning colors and the Apply / Ok buttons disabled.

![jointInspector1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/139993849-jointInspector1.png)

![jointInspector2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2975755465-jointInspector2.png)

All styling will probably be improved in a future pull request once @spaepcke gets to take a look at it. We'll probably use an icon instead of the word "Swap" on the button and maybe handle the red colors differently.
summary.html:
Issue #1500

  • Added the possibility of changing parent / child for joints. Currently, you'd need to delete the joint and make a new one if you chose the wrong links.

  • Added a "Swap" button to swap parent and child links

  • If chosen parent and child links are the same, they're highlighted in warning colors and the Apply / Ok buttons disabled.

All styling will probably be improved in a future pull request once @spaepcke gets to take a look at it. We'll probably use an icon instead of the word "Swap" on the button and maybe handle the red colors differently.

values.description:
Continuation of pull request #1863

1. Load a model which has model plugins. For example:

    gazebo worlds/initial_velocity.world

1. Edit the model (right-click-> Edit Model). You'll see the model plugin name on the palette under Model Plugins (large_wz)

With this pull request, you can:

* Right-click the plugin in the palette and choose to open inspector or delete

* Select the plugin and press the delete key on the keyboard to delete it
values.title: Model Editor: Context menu and deletion for model plugins

values.description:
# New feature

1. Open a world which contains nested models, such as `test/worlds/deeply_nested_models.world`

2. Right-click the model and choose Edit Model.

3. All nested models will appear in the model editor's 3D scene and their names will be nested in the palette under `Nested Models`.

4. Exit and save the model, the saved model contains all nested models in the proper poses.

# Notes

1. Links within nested models can be seen in the 3D scene but they don't show up on the list.

2. All joints declared in the top level are shown, even if they connect deeply nested links. Conversely, if joints connecting top level links are declared within lower layers, they won't show.

# Future pull requests

1. Select and manipulate nested models

2. Delete nested models

3. Nested model context menu and inspector

4. Copy / paste nested models

5. Nested models in the schematic view
values.title: Model Editor: Load and save nested models

summary.raw:
# New feature

1. Open a world which contains nested models, such as `test/worlds/deeply_nested_models.world`

2. Right-click the model and choose Edit Model.

3. All nested models will appear in the model editor's 3D scene and their names will be nested in the palette under `Nested Models`.

4. Exit and save the model, the saved model contains all nested models in the proper poses.

# Notes

1. Links within nested models can be seen in the 3D scene but they don't show up on the list.

2. All joints declared in the top level are shown, even if they connect deeply nested links. Conversely, if joints connecting top level links are declared within lower layers, they won't show.

# Future pull requests

1. Select and manipulate nested models

2. Delete nested models

3. Nested model context menu and inspector

4. Copy / paste nested models

5. Nested models in the schematic view
summary.html:
New feature

  1. Open a world which contains nested models, such as test/worlds/deeply_nested_models.world

  2. Right-click the model and choose Edit Model.

  3. All nested models will appear in the model editor's 3D scene and their names will be nested in the palette under Nested Models.

  4. Exit and save the model, the saved model contains all nested models in the proper poses.

Notes

  1. Links within nested models can be seen in the 3D scene but they don't show up on the list.

  2. All joints declared in the top level are shown, even if they connect deeply nested links. Conversely, if joints connecting top level links are declared within lower layers, they won't show.

Future pull requests

  1. Select and manipulate nested models

  2. Delete nested models

  3. Nested model context menu and inspector

  4. Copy / paste nested models

  5. Nested models in the schematic view

values.description:
I'm preparing some slides and noticed a couple of includes across libraries which don't make sense anymore, so I removed them. I also removed class `gui::ModelBuilderWidget` which had `physics` includes. The class was not being used or even built / installed, so I didn't add the removal to the migration guide.

This is how the library dependencies are now:

# physics

* sensors
* SDF
* math
* transport
* common
* util

# sensors

* physics
* rendering
* SDF
* math
* transport
* common
* util (only system.hh)

# rendering

* SDF
* math
* transport
* common
* util (only system.hh)

# gui

* rendering
* SDF
* math
* transport
* common
* util (only system.hh - LogRecord only for test)

# util 

* SDF
* math
* transport
* common

# common

* physics
* sensors
* rendering
* SDF
* math
* util (only system.hh)
values.title: Remove physics includes from gui and gui includes from rendering

values.description: Some ROS users are still using the joint motors to do velocity control, and these `gzwarn` messages spam the console at every timestep and take a lot of disk space in the log file.
